review: can't really expect much from a $35 dongle! most of the time it streams in 720p which is very watchable for Netflix, Hulu and YouTube, videos maybe very choppy on other websites such as Crackle, TheCW, etc... it also depends on your internet connection, mine is fairly fast at 50mbs down and 15mbs up. i usually watch it at night time or early in the day when no one else is using the internet besides myself. overall, it does the job, it beats using a HDMI cable adapter, but in all honesty, i believe with that, you will get better quality content streaming...

review: I thought this would be the hot ticket to be able to watch movies in my living room, but it for some reason wouldn't work on my LG TV. I even tried different connection cables hooking it through component cables and still wouldn't work. Worked fine on the small tv in my bedroom, but not why I got it. Not sure why it wouldn't even boot up on my LG. Played around for hours, online & message boards, then finally gave up and sent it back.
author: Mudsow

review: Here is a small list of what $35 has allowed me to do:Stream music through my TV's sound system (Google Music)Show pictures from my vacation on the big screen in the living room (AllCast)Allows everyone to see this funny video without having to crowd around my tiny phone (YouTube)Beam Netflix to the big screen (Netflix)Completely mirror my desktop to my TV (Chromecast extension though Chrome)Its cheap, it has multiple uses, its easily concealable on your TV, and its getting better all the time. Why haven't you bought one yet?
author: Randall David Parker
